channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massive pothole in car park, 22nd January
item.description:
The pothole is in the car park in front of subway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approx 10 potholes within 50 metre length of road. A number of these are deep and wide and deteriorating very quickly., 22nd January
item.description:
They are located outside both The Exchange (residential apartments) and the adjacent ladies college boarding lodge. Further potholes in this length of road continue to appear and the existing ones worsen. I often notice vehicles swerving to avoid them which I fear will cause an accident one day soon!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Parabola Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10 inch pothole showing signs of further deterioration to over 12 inches., 22nd January
item.description:
Outbound from Gotherington to the Evesham road, approximately 100yds from the village boundary. The pothole is approximately a metre out from the road edge. The pothole has been there for at least two weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive long pothole, 22nd January
item.description:
Second lane from the left, the one you can also use if you were heading to Sainsbury's, the pothole actually pulls your vehicle as its so long and deep, really dangerous!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth Bypass, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes, 22nd January
item.description:
Three large moon craters, on the corner. Making one side of the road unusable. Might want to fix them, hopefully a better job than the pothole on kings croft road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trevor Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: How was it possible to make it worse than it was before you repaired it?, 22nd January
item.description:
The fact that the repair has made it worse than it was before, thats an achievement in itself. Did you use play-doh to fix it? Maybe actually repair it properly and stop wasting tax payers money? GCC stated "State changed to: Fixed Posted by Gloucestershire County Council at 12:52, Mon 1 December 2025" Its barely lasted 2 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingscroft Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
